parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Free from anxiety (though anxiety is rather too strong a word) or care. Not anxious.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unmarried, of a person not in a state of wedlock, whether he or she has formerly been married or not. Unmarried.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be over-anxious; with acc: To be anxious about, distracted; I care for. From merimna; to be anxious about.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
